definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: His wise leadership brought the people through the war.
sentences.chinese: 他的英明領導使人民安全渡過戰爭關。

sentences.english: There is a dangerous side to excessive solitude spent in efforts at meditation.
sentences.chinese: 在冥思苦想中渡過的徹底隱逸暗藏着危險。

sentences.english: The boat ferried passengers across the bay.
Taking boat pass the Songhua river and saw the sun island.
sentences.chinese: 乘船渡過鬆花江，看到了太陽島。

sentences.english: I want to be the guardians of the helpless bridge so I can accompany you through.
sentences.chinese: 我要做奈何橋的守護者這樣我就可以陪你渡過。

sentences.english: He crossed a lake in a canoe first then took a ship to sail on the canal.
sentences.chinese: 他先乘獨木舟渡過一個湖泊然後乘船在運河上航行。

sentences.english: My exchange semester at Murdoch University was truly amazing!
sentences.chinese: 我在莫道克大學渡過了一個難忘的交流學期。

sentences.english: Some business owners hope to ride out the storm.
sentences.chinese: 一些企業主希望能夠安全渡過這場風暴。

sentences.english: The eagle that soars in the upper air does not worry itself as to how it is to cross rivers. --Selected.
sentences.chinese: 高飛天空的鷲鷹，從不掛慮它將怎樣渡過江河。

sentences.english: The strength of our country bulwarked us through the financial crisis.
sentences.chinese: 我國的實力使我們得以安然渡過這次金融危機。

sentences.english: He did not want to spend his life in courtrooms.
sentences.chinese: 他不想在法庭裏渡過人生。

sentences.english: Moon River, I'll cross you in style some day .
sentences.chinese: 月亮河，總有一天我會體體面面地把你渡過。

sentences.english: ShangYu find RenShun, two people are drinking beer edge through warm night.
sentences.chinese: 尚宇找到仁順，兩個人邊喝啤酒邊渡過溫馨的夜晚。

sentences.english: But the Red Army got the only boat and heroically went over.
sentences.chinese: 可是紅軍得到了唯一的一隻擺渡，英勇地渡過了河。

sentences.english: And this time developers cannot count on credit to tide them over.
sentences.chinese: 而這一次開發商無法指望用信貸來渡過難關。

definition: to pass/to spend (time)/to survive/to get through
to break away from/to cast off (old ideas etc)/to get rid of/to break away (from)/to break out (of)/to free oneself from/to extricate oneself
